rebound.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if a ball or other moving object rebounds, it moves quickly back away from something it has just hit
rebound.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: His shot on goal rebounded off the post.
rebound.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if prices, values etc rebound, they increase again after decreasing
rebound.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Share prices rebounded today after last week’s losses.
rebound.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to catch a basketball after a player has tried but failed to get a point
rebound.translation[1].definitions[0].de: an act of catching a basketball after a player has tried but failed to get a point
rebound.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to increase or grow again after decreasing
rebound.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: signs that the economy will rebound next year
Stock prices rebounded from Wednesday’s steep slide.
